title: How Mass. native Georges Niang reacted to Celtics’ decision to trade him
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Georges Niang was traded from the Celtics to the Utah Jazz shortly after being acquired in a deal involving Kristaps Porzingis.
Niang, a Methuen native, expressed no surprise at the short stint, acknowledging the transient nature of NBA trades.
Despite not playing due to a foot injury, Niang emphasized professionalism and held no hard feelings towards the Celtics.

title: FBI: Two Mass. men arrested in Harvard Medical School explosion
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Two Massachusetts men arrested in connection with Harvard Medical School explosion, FBI confirms.
Explosion occurred at the Goldenson Building, Harvard Medical School, early Saturday; no injuries reported.
FBI and Harvard University Police to provide further details at a 1 p.m. press conference.

title: ‘This has nothing to do with us,’ BPD commissioner says amid Karen Read attorney’s calls for disciplinary review
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Karen Read's attorney, Alan Jackson, urges disciplinary review of Boston Police Commissioner Michael Cox's comments on a related case.
Cox denies involvement, stating he was not aware of Kelly Dever's association with the case, distancing BPD from the matter.
Read was acquitted of the most serious charges in John O'Keefe's death, with only a drunk driving misdemeanor conviction.

title: Missing Worcester woman found dead in car
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Joanna Brown, 30, was found dead in her Mitsubishi Outlander on Mount Vernon St., Worcester, on Monday afternoon.
Brown was last seen leaving her job at Bean Counter Bakery Cafe on Friday and was reported missing Sunday.
Worcester Police and the District Attorney's Office are investigating her death; the cause of death is still unknown.

title: Here’s why Conde Nast Traveler just named Boston one of the best places to go in 2026
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Conde Nast Traveler named Boston a top destination for 2026 due to its history and upcoming epic events.
Boston will host 2026 Sail Boston and parts of the 2026 FIFA World Cup, attracting global visitors.
New attractions like the Atlas Hotel and acclaimed restaurants are enhancing Boston's appeal beyond the downtown area.

title: Milan Lucic joining AHL’s Springfield Thunderbirds for professional tryout
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Milan Lucic joins Springfield Thunderbirds for a professional tryout, aiming for an NHL return.
Lucic, 37, previously played for the Bruins in 2023 and had a tryout with the Blues in 2025.
Lucic has 1,177 NHL games experience and completed the NHL's player assistance program.

title: Seth Meyers responds after Trump calls him a ‘deranged lunatic’ for ‘probably illegal’ late-night jokes
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seth Meyers responded to Donald Trump's criticism after being called a 'deranged lunatic' on Truth Social.
Trump criticized Meyers over a joke about catapults, calling his comments 'probably illegal' in a Truth Social post.
Meyers highlighted Trump’s numerous mentions of catapults, playing clips of Trump saying the word over 40 times.

title: Police investigate apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Police responded to a home on Colonial Drive in Beverly at 9:40 p.m. Monday for an apparent murder-suicide.
A man and a woman were found dead from gunshot wounds; their identities remain undisclosed pending family notification.
Beverly police, State Police, and the Medical Examiner's Office are investigating; officials say there is no public threat.

title: Canton police sergeant involved in Karen Read case placed on leave over alleged misconduct
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Canton Police Sgt. Sean Goode is on paid leave pending an internal probe into misconduct allegations.
An independent investigator was hired after misconduct allegations surfaced during a separate agency investigation.
Goode testified in the high-profile Karen Read case, which concluded with her acquittal on murder charges.

title: It’s the end of the line for Hubba Hubba in Cambridge
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Hubba Hubba in Cambridge is closing on Nov. 24 after 40 years due to financial difficulties.
Owner M.J. Pullins cited rising costs and an economic climate unfavorable for small businesses as reasons for closure.
The store served the alternative and LGBTQ+ community and faced issues like increased rent and water damage costs.
